SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Automatically Set Sharing Settings for Storefront Data

Keep your new storefront data more secure by default, and get started with new storefronts more quickly. An improvement in Salesforce Spring ’20 allows managed packages to set external sharing settings for custom objects. As a result, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now automatically sets the organization-wide default (OWD) external access sharing settings for its custom objects during installation.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: Before Salesforce Spring ’20, you had to manually update the OWD external access sharing settings for B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects in each storefront that you created.

This change ensures that the OWD external access remains Private—the most secure—for as many B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects as possible. As a bonus, this change also helps save you time each time you set up a storefront.

How: If you're upgrading from a previous version of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, this change doesn't affect OWD external access sharing settings that you've already set. No extra action is required. We recommend that you take the opportunity to review your existing sharing settings and ensure that they're as restrictive as possible.

For new installations of B2B Commerce for Visualforce, the managed package automatically sets the OWD external access for the following objects to Public Read Only:

CC Account Group	CC Price Group	CC Rich Content
CC Account Group Price List	CC Price List	CC Rule
CC Attribute	CC Price Modifier	CC Rule Target SKU
CC Category	CC Product	CC Seller
CC Composite Product	CC Product Index	CC Shipping Rate
CC Contact Address	CC Product Inventory Item	CC Site Index
CC Coupon	CC Promotion	CC Spec
CC Page Label	CC Public Cache	CC Subscriber Page
CC Page Section	CC Related Product Group	CC Term

This access is specified using the following field in each object's metadata XML:

<externalSharingModel>read</externalSharingModel>
NOTE As a result of other changes in Salesforce Spring ’20, these external access settings apply only to your storefront's registered users, not to guest users. Manage guest user access to B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects separately.
TIP If you plan to use coupons, manually set the OWD external access for CC Coupon and CC Product to Public Read/Write. The managed package installation doesn't set this access for you.
WARNING If you're not using any of the following objects, we recommend that you set the OWD external access to Private:
CC Coupon	CC Product Inventory Item	CC Seller
CC Price Group	CC Rule	CC Shipping Rate
CC Price Modifier	CC Rule Target SKU	CC Storefront Association

title: Automatically Setting Sharing Settings for B2B Commerce
